page.title: 05TOURISM IN LOCHFOOT
page.content: WHAT IS THE MAIN TOURIST ATTRACTION? LOCHRUTTON LOCH(OLD NAME LOCHRYERTOUN) WHAT SIZE IS IT? ONE MILE LONG AND HALF A MILE WIDE WHICH BURNS FEED THE LOCH? UNDER BRAE LANE(AUCHENFRANCO BURN) AND THE MINNIN BURN WHICH BURN RUNS OUT OF THE LOCH? LOCHFOOT BURN WHICH JOINS CARGEN WATER ARE THERE ANY ISLANDS IN THE LOCH? 1.SWAN ISLAND(CAN BE REACHED ON FOOT WHEN WATER LEVEL IS LOW) 2.DUTTON'S CAIRN(AN IRON-AGE CRANNOG) 3.A REED COVERED ISLAND WHICH SPORTS ARE POSSIBLE ON THE LOCH? 1.ROUGH FISHING( NO PERMIT REQUIRED) 2.CANOING AND BOATING(NO ENGINES!) 3.CURLING(ONLY RARELY) DEPTHS TOO UNEVEN FOR SAILING WHAT IS THE WATER USED FOR? PIPED THROUGH LOCAL FILTER STATION AND ON TO I.C.I.FACTORY AT CARGENBRIDGE.
